snippet: The annual report by the National Urban League ranked metropolitan regions for the largest and smallest gaps in income inequality and unemployment among blacks, Hispanics and whites.
abstract: State of Black America, annual report released by National Urban League, finds that Hispanics generally fare better than blacks in rankings of inequality in American life; report for the first time includes a ranking of income inequality and unemployment for 77 American cities that had large black populations and 83 cities that had large Hispanic populations.
lead_paragraph: The annual report by the National Urban League ranked metropolitan regions for the largest and smallest gaps in income inequality and unemployment among blacks, Hispanics and whites.

headline.main: Report Finds Hispanics Faring Better Than Blacks
headline.print_headline: Report Finds Hispanics Faring Better Than Blacks
